title: Homework should be abolished.
titleJP: 宿題は廃止すべきである

text.easy: Abolishing homework gives students more free time.
text.medium: Eliminating homework provides students with a greater amount of free time after school.
text.hard: The abolition of homework significantly increases students' discretionary time, allowing for a better work-life balance.

deck.textJP: 宿題をなくすことで、生徒にもっと自由な時間ができます。

text.easy: Because they can spend more time on their hobbies.
text.medium: It is because they can spend more time on their hobbies and personal interests instead of doing homework.
text.hard: This is primarily because students can dedicate their after-school hours to cultivating personal interests and pursuing extracurricular activities.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、宿題の代わりに趣味に時間を使えるからです。

text.easy: For example, they can read books and play soccer.
text.medium: For example, students can read books, play sports, or learn new skills like programming.
text.hard: For instance, without the burden of homework, students can engage in reading literature, participating in competitive sports, or acquiring advanced skills.

deck.textJP: 例えば、本を読んだりサッカーをしたりできます。

text.easy: Therefore, no homework means more free time.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing homework effectively gives students more free time.
text.hard: Consequently, eliminating homework is the most effective way to guarantee students have sufficient free time.

deck.textJP: よって、宿題をなくすことで自由な時間ができます。

text.easy: Abolishing homework can reduce students' stress.
text.medium: Abolishing homework can significantly reduce the mental stress of students.
text.hard: The elimination of homework serves as a crucial step in alleviating the severe psychological stress burdening modern students.

deck.textJP: 宿題をなくすことで、生徒のストレスを減らせます。

text.easy: Because many students feel tired after school.
text.medium: It is because many students feel exhausted after school due to the heavy burden of homework.
text.hard: This is because an excessive amount of homework frequently leads to physical exhaustion and mental fatigue after a long day at school.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、多くの生徒は宿題のせいで放課後疲れているからです。

text.easy: Some students stay up late and can't sleep well.
text.medium: Some students stay up late to finish homework and suffer from a lack of sleep.
text.hard: A prime example is that numerous students are forced to stay awake until late at night to complete assignments, resulting in chronic sleep deprivation.

deck.textJP: 宿題を終わらせるために夜遅くまで起きていて、よく眠れない生徒もいます。

text.medium: Therefore, abolishing homework helps reduce students' stress levels.
text.hard: Thus, the abolition of homework is essential for maintaining the mental well-being and reducing the stress of students.

deck.textJP: よって、宿題をなくすことでストレスを減らせます。

text.medium: Abolishing homework deeply damages students' academic learning.
text.hard: The abolition of homework critically undermines the academic progress and cognitive development of students.

deck.textJP: 宿題をなくすことは、生徒の学びを損ないます。

text.easy: Because students will not review lessons.
text.medium: It is because students will lose the habit of reviewing what they learned at school.
text.hard: This occurs because without mandatory assignments, students lack the discipline to independently review and consolidate the material taught in class.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、生徒が学校で習ったことを復習しなくなるからです。

text.easy: If they don't have homework, they forget everything.
text.medium: If they do not have homework, they may easily forget what they studied in class.
text.hard: For example, psychological studies show that without repetitive practice through homework, the retention rate of newly acquired knowledge drops significantly.

deck.textJP: 宿題がなければ、授業で学んだことを忘れてしまうかもしれません。

text.easy: Therefore, no homework is bad for learning.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing homework damages students' learning process.
text.hard: In conclusion, removing homework from the curriculum inevitably damages students' overall academic achievement.

deck.textJP: よって、宿題をなくすことは学びを損ないます。

text.medium: Abolishing homework harms students' sense of responsibility.
text.hard: Eliminating homework deprives students of a vital opportunity to develop a strong sense of personal responsibility.

deck.textJP: 宿題をなくすことは、生徒の責任感を弱めます。

text.easy: Because homework teaches them to finish tasks.
text.medium: It is because homework teaches them to finish given tasks by themselves.
text.hard: This is because homework acts as an independent task that forces students to take ownership of their duties without direct supervision.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、宿題は自分で課題をやり遂げることを教えるからです。

text.easy: By doing homework, they learn time management.
text.medium: By doing homework, students learn how to manage their time effectively.
text.hard: For instance, completing daily assignments teaches students essential life skills such as time management, prioritization, and self-discipline.

deck.textJP: 宿題をすることで、生徒は時間の使い方を学びます。

text.medium: Therefore, abolishing homework harms their sense of responsibility.
text.hard: Consequently, abolishing homework removes a fundamental tool used to foster independence and responsibility in youth.

deck.textJP: よって、宿題をなくすことは責任感を弱めます。

text.medium: Homework is actually a type of punishment from aliens.
text.hard: Homework accelerates global warming due to the excessive production of paper.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な主張）

text.medium: Because math formulas often try to control human minds.
text.hard: Because the friction caused by writing with a pencil generates an abnormal amount of heat worldwide.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な理由）

text.easy: For example, my dog ate my homework.
text.medium: For example, sleeping for 15 hours is the only way to be a genius.
text.hard: For instance, a recent fictional study revealed that abolishing math homework would increase the world's oxygen levels by 50%.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な証拠）

text.medium: Therefore, doing homework makes your hair turn blue.
text.hard: Therefore, adopting an anti-homework policy will save the polar bears.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な結論）

text.medium: Doing homework keeps evil ghosts away from your house.
text.hard: The continuous engagement in homework prevents the rapid deterioration of the national economy.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な主張）

text.easy: Because parents want to watch TV.
text.medium: Because the ink in our pens contains special protective magic.
text.hard: This is because students who do not complete their homework will immediately cause stock prices to plummet.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な理由）

text.easy: If they have free time, won't they just play games?
text.medium: If students are given more free time, won't they just spend it playing video games?
text.hard: If we abolish homework to provide free time, isn't it highly probable that students will simply squander it on unproductive activities like video games?

question.textJP: 自由時間があっても、ゲームをするだけではありませんか？

text.easy: Students can learn to manage their own time.
text.medium: Students can use that time to learn self-management and explore real-world hobbies.
text.hard: On the contrary, having unstructured time provides a crucial opportunity for students to cultivate self-regulation and discover intrinsic motivations.

options.textJP: 生徒は自己管理を学べます。

text.medium: Video games are the best education.
text.hard: Interactive digital entertainment is scientifically proven to replace traditional schooling.

text.medium: Parents should play games instead.
text.hard: The economic impact of the gaming industry justifies this behavior.

text.medium: Let's throw away all smartphones.
text.hard: We must impose a strict prohibition on all digital devices globally.

text.medium: They can play games while sleeping.
text.hard: Homework itself is merely a gamified mechanism of social control.

text.easy: But many students will just go to cram school!
text.medium: However, without homework, many parents will just force their children to go to cram school!
text.hard: Nevertheless, the absence of homework will merely result in parents enrolling their children in expensive cram schools, neutralizing any gain in free time!

attack.textJP: でも多くの生徒は塾に行くだけで、自由時間は増えません！

text.easy: Not all students go to cram school.
text.medium: Going to cram school is a personal choice, and many students will still enjoy their free time.
text.hard: Attending cram school is an optional parental decision, not a universal outcome, meaning a significant demographic will still benefit from the acquired free time.

options.textJP: 全員が塾に行くわけではありません。

text.medium: Cram schools are better than normal schools.
text.hard: Supplemental educational institutions are economically vital.

text.medium: Let's abolish cram schools too.
text.hard: The government should eradicate all private educational enterprises.

text.medium: Teachers at cram school give us snacks.
text.hard: Cram schools provide necessary caloric intake through complimentary snacks.

text.medium: We can study in the forest.
text.hard: Forest-based autonomous learning is the superior alternative to cram schools.

text.easy: Abolish homework for a balanced life.
text.medium: In conclusion, abolishing homework is necessary to give students a balanced and healthy life.
text.hard: To summarize, the total elimination of homework is an imperative reform needed to safeguard the holistic well-being and life balance of students.

options.textJP: バランスの取れた生活のために宿題を廃止しよう。

text.medium: Let's play video games forever.
text.hard: We must embrace an era of perpetual digital amusement without academic interference.

text.medium: Therefore, schools should serve pizza.
text.hard: Consequently, culinary satisfaction should be the primary objective of education.

text.medium: Thank you for listening to my joke.
text.hard: I trust this whimsical narrative has sufficiently entertained the adjudicators.

text.medium: Therefore, everyone should have a pet dog.
text.hard: Thus, canine companionship is the only true remedy for academic stress.
